actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations

official_title: To amend chapter 37 of title 31, United States Code, with respect to debt collection by the United States.

summary.text: Debt Collection Amendments Act of 1990 - Amends Federal debt collection law to increase from $20,000 to $100,000 the amount of an outstanding debt that may be compromised by an agency head. Prohibits an agency head from collecting on a Federal claim by administrative offset if such claim is subject to the Contract Disputes Act of 1978. Applies the ordinary administrative offset as well as penalty and interest rules to debtors which are State or local government agencies. Permits the recovery of interest that has accrued on a Federal claim prior to certain notice requirements. Extends a certain debt collection pilot program regarding contracts for collection services.

titles.title: To amend chapter 37 of title 31, United States Code, with respect to debt collection by the United States.
